alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 12:31AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Franklin and northeastern St. Lawrence Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 1230 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicates training thunderstorms over Colton, Potsdam, and Hopkinton moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Observations indicate an inch to an inch and a half has fallen. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Potsdam, Moira, Bangor, Parishville, Colton, Bombay, Bryants Mill, Burke, Brushton, Lawrenceville, Malone, Debar Mountain, Chateaugay, Brasher Falls, Lake Ozonia, Madawaska, Dickinson, Pierrepont, Constable and Hopkinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for northern New York.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence
